infos.info: The Big Broadcast has it airing on CBS at 9:00-9:45 p.m. Sunday nights. The program often originated from two locations at once: Berle and Hall directing a studio audience in New York, Jones and Hare directing another in Philadelphia.

Hickerson reports that the Milton Berle Show was known as Let Yourself Go (3/21/1944-6/27/1945), Kiss and Make Up (7/1/1946-8/19/1946) and At Home with the Berles (3/11/1947-4/13/1948). - In addition, Dunning reports that it was known as the Texaco Star Theater (9/22/1948-6/15/1949).

synopses.synopsis: 30-minute game show hosted by Milton Berle. Contestants were married couples who aired their grievances before a panel of audience members. The panel decided who was at fault and the penalty was to kiss and make up. - (Handbook of Old-Time Radio p.407)

Community Sing is notable as one of the earliest radio efforts of comedian Milton Berle. Though the show was obviously heavy on comedy, the title derived from the group-singing of the studio audience... - On the Air: The Encyclopedia of Old-Time Radio by John Dunning
